title: Claude Monet Boxed Note Cards
description:
Cards developed from Claude Monet’s: Cliffwalk at Pourville, 1882; Bordighera, 1884; The Artist's House at Argenteuil, 1873; and, On the Bank of the Seine, Bennecourt, 1868, from the Art Institute of Chicago’s collection.

Claude Monet was a pioneer of the French artistic movement known as Impressionism. Monet portrayed the people closest to him and the places he knew best. In the early years he painted the forests of Fountainbleau, Parisian boulevards, suburban villages along the Seine, seaside towns, and flowering fields.

  • Card dimensions: 3.25 x 4.75 in.
  • Box dimensions: 4 x 5.5 x 2 in.
  • Set of 20 cards and envelopes.
  • 5 cards per image.
  • Box lid has magnetic closure.
